text:
ce="preserve">The 2017–18 UEFA Champions League knockout phase was the knockout stage which started on 13 February and ended on 26 May 2018 with the last match at the NSC Olimpiyskiy Stadium in Kiev, Ukraine, to decide the champions of the 2017–18 UEFA Champions League. A total of 16 teams compete in the knockout phase.
Round and draw dates.
All draws where held at the UEFA headquarters in Nyon, Switzerland.
Matches.
"Manchester City won 5–2 on aggregate."
"Real Madrid won 5–2 on aggregate."
"2–2 on aggregate. Roma won on away goals."
"Bayern Munich won 8–1 on aggregate."
Quarter-finals.
The draw for the quarter-finals was held on 16 March 2018, 12:00 CET.<section end=QF />
Matches.
"4–4 on aggregate. Roma won on away goals."
"Bayern Munich won 2–1 on aggregate."
"Real Madrid won 4–3 on aggregate."
Semi-finals.
The draw for the semi-finals was held on 13 April 2018, 13:00 CEST.<section end=SF />
For the first time since the 2009–10 UEFA Champions League, all the four teams at this stage represent different national associations.
Matches.
"Real Madrid won 4–3 on aggregate."
Final.
The final was played at the NSC Olimpiyskiy Stadium in Kiev on 26 May 2018. The "home" team (for administrative purposes) was determined by an additional draw held after the semi-final draw.
